intro: Sadiria yingjiangensis, commonly known as the Yingshang bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and is adapted to temperate climates. It features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
